record.description: ANNOUNCE
MAP
PEER
AUTHENTICATION
Unassigned
Reserved
Reserved for Private Use
Reserved

record.name: SUCCESS
record.description: Success.

record.name: UNSUPP_VERSION
record.description: The version number at the start of the PCP Request header is not recognized by this PCP server. This is a long lifetime error. describes PCP version 2.

record.name: NOT_AUTHORIZED
record.description: The requested operation is disabled for this PCP client, or the PCP client requested an operation that cannot be fulfilled by the PCP server's security policy. This is a long lifetime error.

record.name: MALFORMED_REQUEST
record.description: The request could not be successfully parsed. This is a long lifetime error.

record.name: UNSUPP_OPCODE
record.description: Unsupported Opcode. This is a long lifetime error.

record.name: UNSUPP_OPTION
record.description: Unsupported Option. This error only occurs if the Option is in the mandatory-to-process range. This is a long lifetime error.

record.name: MALFORMED_OPTION
record.description: Malformed Option (e.g., appears too many times, invalid length). This is a long lifetime error.

record.name: NETWORK_FAILURE
record.description: The PCP server or the device it controls are experiencing a network failure of some sort (e.g., has not obtained an External IP address). This is a short lifetime error.

record.name: NO_RESOURCES
record.description: Request is well-formed and valid, but the server has insufficient resources to complete the requested operation at this time. For example, the NAT device cannot create more mappings at this time, is short of CPU cycles or memory, or is unable to handle the request due to some other temporary condition. The same request may succeed in the future. This is a system-wide error, different from USER_EX_QUOTA. This can be used as a catch- all error, should no other error message be suitable. This is a short lifetime error.

record.name: UNSUPP_PROTOCOL
record.description: Unsupported transport protocol, e.g. SCTP in a NAT that handles only UDP and TCP. This is a long lifetime error.

record.name: USER_EX_QUOTA
record.description: This attempt to create a new mapping would exceed this subscriber's port quota. This is a short lifetime error.

record.name: CANNOT_PROVIDE_EXTERNAL
record.description:
The suggested external port and/or external address cannot be provided. This error MUST only be returned for: * MAP requests that included the PREFER_FAILURE Option (normal MAP requests will return an available external port); * MAP requests for the SCTP protocol (PREFER_FAILURE is implied); * PEER requests.
See Section 13.2 of for processing details. The error lifetime depends on the reason for the failure.

record.name: ADDRESS_MISMATCH
record.description: The source IP address of the request packet does not match the contents of the PCP Client's IP Address field, due to an unexpected NAT on the path between the PCP client and the PCP-controlled NAT or firewall. This is a long lifetime error.

record.name: EXCESSIVE_REMOTE_PEERS
record.description: The PCP server was not able to create the filters in this request. This result code MUST only be returned if the MAP request contained the FILTER Option. See Section 13.3 for processing information. This is a long lifetime error.

record.name: INITIATION
record.description: The client includes this PCP result code in its request to the server for authentication.

record.name: AUTHENTICATION_REQUIRED
record.description: This error response is sent to the client if EAP authentication is required.

record.name: AUTHENTICATION_FAILED
record.description: This error response is sent to the client if EAP authentication failed.

record.name: AUTHENTICATION_SUCCEEDED
record.description: This success response is sent to the client if EAP authentication succeeded.

record.name: AUTHORIZATION_FAILED
record.description: This error response is sent to the client if EAP authentication succeeded but authorization failed.

record.name: SESSION_TERMINATED
record.description: This PCP result code indicates to the partner that the PA session must be terminated.

record.name: UNKNOWN_SESSION_ID
record.description: This error response is sent from the PCP server if there is no known PA session associated with the Session ID sent in the PA request or common PCP request from the PCP client.

record.name: DOWNGRADE_ATTACK_DETECTED
record.description: This PCP result code indicates to the client that the server detected a downgrade attack.

record.name: AUTHENTICATION_REQUEST
record.description: The server indicates to the client that the PA message contains an EAP request.

record.name: AUTHENTICATION_REPLY
record.description: The client indicates to the server that the PA message contains an EAP response.

record.name: THIRD_PARTY_ID_UNKNOWN
record.description: The provided identifier in a THIRD_PARTY_ID option is unknown/unavailable to the PCP server. This is a long lifetime error.

record.name: THIRD_PARTY_MISSING_OPTION
record.description: This error occurs if both THIRD_PARTY and THIRD_PARTY_ID options are expected in a request but one option is missing. This is a long lifetime error.

record.name: UNSUPP_THIRD_PARTY_ID_LENGTH
record.description: The received option length is not supported. This is a long lifetime error.

registry.title: PCP Options
registry.note: Values 0-127 are mandatory to process, and 128-255 are optional to process.

record.name: THIRD_PARTY
record.purpose: Indicates the MAP or PEER request is for a host other than the host sending the PCP Option.
record.may-appear-in: Request. May appear in response only if it appeared in the associated request.

record.name: PREFER_FAILURE
record.purpose: Indicates that the PCP server should not create an alternative mapping if the suggested external port and address cannot be mapped.
record.may-appear-in: Request. May appear in response only if it appeared in the associated request.

record.name: FILTER
record.purpose: Specifies a filter for incoming packets.
record.may-appear-in: Request. May appear in response only if it appeared in the associated request.
record.maximum: As many as fit within maximum PCP message size.

record.name: PRF
record.maximum: As many as fit within maximum PCP message size.

record.name: MAC_ALGORITHM
record.maximum: As many as fit within maximum PCP message size.

record.name: THIRD_PARTY_ID
record.purpose: Together with the THIRD_PARTY option, the THIRD_PARTY_ID option identifies a third party for which a request for an external IP address and port is made.
record.may-appear-in: Request. May appear in response only if it appeared in the associated request.

record.name: DESCRIPTION
record.purpose: Used to associate a text description with a mapping.
record.may-appear-in: Request. May appear in response only if it appeared in the associated request.

record.name: PREFIX64
record.purpose: Learn the prefix used by the NAT64 to build IPv4-converted IPv6 addresses. This is used by a host for local address synthesis (e.g., when an IPv4 address is present in referrals).
record.maximum: 1 for a request. As many as fit within the maximum PCP message size for a response.

record.name: CHECKPOINT_REQUIRED
record.purpose: Indicate if an entry needs to be check-pointed.
